Super fun game, greatly recommend. Only two issues: 1) it's often difficult to know specifically which piece of evidence to prove your point. (example: you need to look at a statue and deduce with a photo. However, you can look at the statue directly, or by looking at something else, with the statue still well in frame. If you do the latter, it does not work.) 2) ohmygod the final boss fight is so long. It's a pain. Still super interesting, definitely worth the money.
Even though the gameplay is different from the other Ace Attorney games I loved the story and everyone should play these series.

Compared to apollo ace justice this game have a appropriate length. I beat this game within 15-16 days while in apollo I spend only 3-4 days to finished it. which can consider the price is more reasonable. However, the image or story is less interesting no special ability too. I loved all characters in this game. All have a very cute&unique personality .

I LOVE EDGEY-WEDGEY and this game allows you to learn more about him, while checking out crime scenes, carry out investigations, hear character's testimonys, press and present contridicting evidence to find the truth! Just like a real detective/prosecutor!!

Amazing game with a unique perspective, an array of complex and likeable characters and a few familiar faces. I felt it took a little longer to complete than the mainstream games, but love how each case is connected. Hope Capcom decide to localise AAI2 in the future. No spoilers from previous AA cases so you can play at any time. Would recomend!

fun game.

A thoroughly enjoyable spin-off which distinguishes itself from the main Ace Attorney series mainly by taking on a more serious tone. It was nice how all the cases were connected to each other, coming together to tell a coherent and interesting story about an international smuggling ring and Interpol's efforts to stop it.   Honestly, I still hope Capcom will consider translating Gyakuten Kenji 2 sometime soon, it'd be fantastic to continue the not-terribly-madcap adventures of Edgeworth, Kay and Gumshoe.

I love Ace Attorney franchise and I'm glad they're porting it on mobile with high quality textures and adjusted interface. This port is really smooth and works well. I hope more people get into AA and can experience and support it.

PSA: This game requires an internet connection. This Nintendo DS game from 2009 will not launch, and is not playable, from airplane mode. Absolutely unacceptable.

I am so glad I was able to replay this again. Bought it on launch on DS so it was really refreshing being able to experience everything at a higher resolution. The only draw backs are minor: the sprites during investigations don't look well with nearest neighbor (only an issue if you play on a 7"+ tablet) and there was a small amount of lag moving around on my phone on some screens (A mid-range device: Moto G5s Plus). A great contrast to the main series. It's unfortunate the DS game didn't sell well enough to get the sequel officially.
Rating is for online only, so if you buy it for a long offline journey, well Capcom laughs at you. It's a shame because the game itself is amazing.
Great game! You must play till the end!

Dammnit, Capcom! Stop making one of my favorite, most beloved game series available for Android, and then strangling the life out of it with a connection requirement AND an inability to remain open in the background, especially once you turn off the phones radios. I have a Galaxy Note 8, it has 6 GB RAM, your game was on the DS. Fix it, its embarrassing.

Firstly you have to be online to start this game, and there's no mention of 
this anywhere on app description. On my phone this isn't an issue but it's 
useless if I install it on my tablet. Also there aren't Google play 
achievements which is a shame. I wish Capcom would could fix these 2 
issues, it's 2018, I've paid for the game on Google Play yet people who 
cheat and pirate get to play the the game offline... This isn't fair

Having played this on and off for the last few months- busy with school and all that- I can fortunately say this is the definitive version of AAI so far. And yes, even compared to the original DS version The original was prone to occasional lag and jutter, and of course DIDN'T have HD sprites: this one has no such slowdowns, is smooth as butter and looks great... save perhaps when in 'investigation mode', but that's a minor qualm.   Aside from that, the only other thing I feel called upon to say is that if you've never played an Ace Attorney and are looking for one to start with, this is as good as one as any to start with. It may have a high price tag (for an app), but between the great visuals, fantastic writing and engaging 'mystery solving'  gameplay, I don't think you'll be disappointed :)
The game itself is great, but I'm appalled that it requires an internet connection to play.
Not a good port. Ran terribly and the original just looks better. Other Ace ports are top notch.

Bought this game to support the series! I love the new sprites~ I wish the moving sprites(? idk what they're called) were improved as well but it doesn't really bother me that much. As others said, it's a bit slow but it's just a small issue. Great port all in all! Maybe bring AA trilogy next, or AAI2? Pretty please? :)

It's very slow. Most of the Ace games, when switched from the ds to tablet/phone. It's more fluid. The graphics aren't as good as the other Ace mobile games.  I love these games so I hope it gets better.
One of my favourite games when it came out on the DS. Still a great game even today though I WISH that they localize Ace Attorney  Investigations 2. I would by it for an instant, even on my phone.
I was really happy, that you started, realising this series on Android, but why is this online mod only?

Def not worth it. It's like playing a choose your own adventure book, but one where *none* of the options is what you want/make total sense.  So you pick the one that sounds kind of right, but not quite.  You go to the page and you "fail", but you fail exactly because it's not exactly what you wanted to do in the first place.  It wouldn't be *that* bad if it wasn't for the *painfully* slow and repetitive padding "dialog". There are tons of scenes where Miles says something almost meaningful, the opponent scoffs/plays with their shirt or whip slowly, cut back to Miles saying something meaningless in response, cut back to opponent saying something scoffing/playing with their shirt or whip *slowly*.  You can *ONLY* "skip" a single line of text.  The best you can do is start scene, tap to skip the line you've read a million times immediately (instead of waiting to print one character at a time) *BUT* sit there and wait for whatever stupid animation to fully complete exactly as slow as before, *then* you can go to the next scene.   Terrible writing. Esp last case is full of deus ex machina a new person swoops in at the last second and magically pads it out longer.
A great port. Minor lag while walking.
This is for me the best of the Ace Attorney series, I played the original trilogy some time ago and I loved Edgeworth as the main character, he is my favorite since the first game :)
Didn't even know this came out until now! Thank you very much for releasing, I very much hope you continue to port Ace Attorney games as well as Ghost Trick

Amazing game! I am very pleased that this game contains some of my favourite characters namely, Edgeworth, Francizska and Gumshoe. The developers have clearly placed a lot of effort into this game, because the cases are very well put together and a lot of time and effort has gone into the final case that is full of intrigue. I would like to ask CAPCOM to kindly bring out the English translation of AAI2 here as well. Please do it for the fans!!! Please.

It's finally here! Miles Edgeworth is my favorite character in the whole series! Played this on DS, still buying the Android version without second thoughts. Play port the whole series and maybe even bring Phoenix vs Layton?!  ETA - after playing for awhile I do notice graphics lagging here and there. Hopefully a later update will have that fixed.
Amazing entry in the Ace Attorney series! The gameplay and story is fantastic. If only we had a sequel!

I love the Ace Attorney series but the graphics are seriously messed up on my Huawei Media Tablet T-3. I started with the first case and and seen the same result in other chapter where character colors and shapes are distorted and when it closes in on them their faces and body's are also distorted. Gumshoe barely had a face when it cut to the up close of him. Other than that it is great. I believe it may just something with this game though as I have Apollo Justice and Dual Destinies and have not had this problem with either.
I really love this game and I'm in love with the crisp new HD sprites (the overworld sprites are still the same though). I really hope they localize and release the 2nd game.

This is easily in my top 5 Ace Attorney games altogether. A solid plotline that ties every case together well, great characters, no subpar chapters overall, and a final episode that's very engaging and satisfying to play.   Hopefully an AAI2 localization is on the way in the near future, but either way this game's worth a million cents (okay, definitely not THAT much).
Miles Edgeworth is the best genre.
So happy this is out on mobile. Love the characters and gameplay.
One of the greatest AA games. A must play for any fan of the series. Hopefully AAI2 will get a release in the West too please we've been waiting for years.

A very cool way to introduce the AAI series once again. A fresh way of playing the Ace Attorney series, with a great scenario. Now, I wish Capcom will take it a step further and port AAI2 with a translation.
Easily my favourite entry into the series. Constantly mixes things up, and has compelling cases, opponents and my favourite finale of them all. A must-buy for any Wright fan :D
